alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Currituck and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 500 PM EDT... At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Back Bay to Knotts Island to near Currituck. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Knotts Island, Corolla, Barco, Waterlily and Maple. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
